channel.title: [open source project] RSCSC client
channel.description:
RSCShadow and I have noticed that there are loads of rsc servers. We are currently developing a client [b](RuneScape Classic Shared client)[/b] that can be used for 20 servers. It will feature nice GUI's items ids (if your server will allow free items). It will also feature a interactive world map. It will be a single exe file. It will be very simple for people who have never played a rsc server before. The point of this project will be to help gain people to [b]your servers [/b]. There will be a server list in the application for people that would like to have their RSC servers show on the list. You will also be able to connect to other servers with a easy-to-use ip and port config gui. If anyone is interested in showing their server on the server list please post below. Pics will be added as time goes on. Constructive criticism is accepted on this project ;D This client will support easyrsc and Rscd. This will be a great free way to get people one your server.
People on the server list so far: [code] My server :D PvP Power Level Explosion Darscape
[/code] [u][b][i]3[/i][/b][/u] our of our[u] [b][i]20[/i][/b][/u] spots have been taken already. requirements for adding your server to the list: [code] Virus free client Server being up more than 75% of the time Working registration [/code] I have found it obviously that this project is do difficult and would require a giant download for every custom server. The ip connect will still be added, but not might work for every server. I have decided that i will have 10-20 servers hosted on the client. If you would like to be hosted (added to the list) you must: [code] Post a reply to the topic saying you'd like a spot Give me the url to the client if you have custom packet ids, sprites, landscape etc. in your message
[/code]

item.title: [open source project] RSCSC client
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“roflcopterofl, post:31, topic:333100”][quote author=imthenull link=topic=429516.msg3154372#msg3154372 date=1268874371]

actually the server is never up, full of viruses and does not work.

I want.

I’m testing it right now. No viruses yet.

lmao it has no viruses, according to http://rsc.serverstatuspage.com/ im up 98% of the time and its easyRSC based. Finally, of coarse it works…
[/quote]
Alright sounds good. I’ll add tommorow. I’ve having a few problems logining into some of my accounts on other websites. i wonder whats up. Jk[/quote]

Yeah, i h4xed them! lol jk, i wouldnt do that =p

Read full topic

item.title: [open source project] RSCSC client
item.dc:creator: @roflcopterofl roflcopterofl
item.description:
@roflcopterofl wrote:

UPDATE : If our client doesn’t work with yours we can always take your normal client and put it in it. I’ve tried it yesterday. The easy-to-use ip is mainly for the people who have just started with a private server making ( unedited sources [aka fail servers]) If you want your server hosted pm me a download link to your client and I will kindly put it in free of charge. I’m actually thinking of making a normal webclient too. This would be sweet. ;D I’m just worried that if for whatever reason someone’s running it with a server they doesn’t allow mortified clients. Then it’ll detect it like rscangel does (so i’ve heard) and the player will get banned. I’m still following through with this project because i would need to make it anyway when i get our 85% edited server running with RSCShadow.

Read full topic

item.title: [open source project] RSCSC client
item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:1, topic:333166”]Won’t work on RSCE.

The best thing you could do is make a web client for EasyRSC servers so their owners can setup their server and allow people to use the web client to connect… Such as…

hey guys made a new server, come play http://www.moparsc.com/webclient.php?server=127.0.0.1&port=43594

It would stop people spreading viruses etc too, that’s if the owners actually decided to go with it.

Server list on the side, can instantly login with any username/password (so you don’t have to worry about creating characters).

That’s the only thing that’d work tbh.[/quote]

hats a pretty cool idea using a webclient, you could make so you can write the ip in the client like rs2 and maby choose client versions but still there the packet sending problem…

Read full topic
